refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a string containing a UDT definition

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function is used to create a user defined type (UDT) definition automatically based on a WSDL file. The source WSDL is supplied via a URL.
The returned definition can be saved to a file and/or executed automatically to provide instant access to the new UDT.

note.title: Note:
note.para: To save the file you must have an appropriate ACL defined.

refsect2.title: url
refsect2.para: The URI of the target WSDL file to build a UDT definition of.

refsect2.title: f
refsect2.para: The name of the file if the definition is to be saved. This will produce a file on the file system under the server root directory.
The default value is NULL, which will not create a file.

refsect2.title: exec
refsect2.para: This flag indicates whether the definition should be immediately executed upon import. This takes the form of 0 or 1. The default value of 0 will not execute the definition.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: This function returns the text of the UDT definition as a varchar.

example.title: Simple example of a WSDL driven UDT
